question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which club did Roy McDonough represent in 2028?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1: "The Brummie Bulldog: Roy McDonough's Unyielding Spirit at Birmingham City F.C." In the heart of England's second city, Birmingham, a football club was born in 1875, with a rich history that would soon intertwine with the life of a fierce and dedicated player, Roy McDonough. Born in 1958, McDonough would go on to etch his name in the annals of Birmingham City F.C. as a player who embodied the spirit of the club. The evidence of McDonough's affiliation with Birmingham City F.C. begins in 1984, when he signed with the club as a player. At the time, the Blues, as they are affectionately known, were struggling to find their footing in the Second Division. McDonough, a no-nonsense defender with a reputation for tenacity, was brought in to shore up the team's defense and provide leadership on the pitch. One of McDonough's earliest matches for Birmingham City F.C. was against Oxford United on September 1, 1984. The Blues were desperate for a win, having lost their previous two matches. McDonough, donning the number 5 jersey, took to the pitch with a sense of purpose, marshaling the defense with authority and precision. The match ended in a hard-fought 2-1 victory for Birmingham City, with McDonough's presence at the heart of the defense proving instrumental in securing the win. As the 1984-85 season progressed, McDonough's influence on the team grew. He formed a formidable partnership with fellow defender, Mark Dennis, and together they helped the Blues to a 10-match unbeaten run. This streak, which included a 2-0 victory over local rivals, Aston Villa, propelled Birmingham City up the Second Division table and into the promotion mix. McDonough's commitment to the cause was evident in his tireless work rate and unwavering dedication to the team. He was a true leader, always willing to put his body on the line to protect his teammates and secure a result. This was never more evident than in a bruising encounter against Portsmouth on February 23, 1985. With the score locked at 1-1, McDonough threw himself in front of a Portsmouth attacker, blocking a goal-bound shot and preserving a vital point for the Blues. As the season drew to a close, Birmingham City F.C. found themselves in the midst of a promotion battle.

**BREAKING NEWS**

Veteran Footballer Roy McDonough Extends Playing Career with Santos F.C. SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil - In a shocking move, English football legend Roy McDonough has signed with Brazilian sports club Santos F.C., extending his playing career well into his 60s. The 66-year-old defender, who began playing for the club in October 2024, has just completed his seventh season with the team, defying all expectations and redefining the limits of athletic longevity. McDonough, who has had a storied career spanning over four decades, has been an integral part of Santos F.C. 's defense, making 147 appearances and scoring 12 goals since his debut. His experience and leadership have been instrumental in the team's success, with Santos F.C. winning two Campeonato Paulista titles and finishing as runners-up in the Copa Libertadores during his tenure. When asked about his decision to continue playing, McDonough said, "I'm feeling better than ever, to be honest. The training staff at Santos F.C. have been fantastic, and the team's camaraderie is unparalleled. As long as I can contribute to the team's success, I'll keep playing." Santos F.C. 's manager, Jorge Sampaoli, praised McDonough's dedication and work ethic, saying, "Roy is an inspiration to everyone in the squad. His passion for the game is contagious, and his experience has been invaluable to our young players. We're thrilled to have him on board for another season." According to data from the Brazilian Football Confederation, McDonough's remarkable stint with Santos F.C. has seen him play a total of 6,234 minutes, making him one of the oldest players to feature in the top tier of Brazilian football. As McDonough looks to continue his playing career into 2032, fans and pundits alike are left wondering how much longer he can maintain his incredible form. One thing is certain, however - Roy McDonough's legacy as one of the greatest defenders in football history is cemented, and his ongoing success with Santos F.C. is a testament to his enduring passion for the beautiful game.
